title: How to prepare for the NEET 2021 if I start from now? Will I be able to score 600+ in the NEET 2021? How can I complete my 2-year syllabus - Self study for NEET - Quora

response.answer_text: Listen if u seriously want to start from now , then there are two ways to do that , First of all, if u are not at all prepared for anything , that means u are not ready with ur syllabus then keep everything aside(including ur gadgets too) and just go through NCERT again and again u should do it for 3–4 times then u shall go to the previous year papers and solve some papers of theNTA app frequently.Secondly, if u are prepared with ur syllabus and feel confident enough then also keep everything aside and just head towards the papers . Solve as many as you can , but after every paper spare around 1–2 hours for complete analysis. Try to spare atleast 6–8 hours of quality study time for urself .That's it , now you can head towards the NEET Examination Hall comfortably and please just don't think about 600+ everytime. Try to stay fresh for your exam . It all depends upon you how you deal with urself and the paper Infront of you.Finally I would like to say “ STUDY LIKE YOU HAVE EVERYTHING TO LOSE , BUT ATTEMPT THE PAPER LIKE YOU HAVE NOTHING TO LOSE”. Thanks and All the best for neet ug 2020.

Yes definitely you can do it but it's not easy for you not just for you, not for everyone you have to work hard for the exam with that you have to just concentrate on the study you have to give up all your other things. Here I'm giving you steps for the preparation I hope you will understand clearly and start preparation according to these Your time table must be practical and it should take into account your school/ tuition hours. The time table must also take into account the break time, nap-time and any other daily activity that you perform. Stick to the prescribed syllabusSolve numerical for physics and chemistrystudy materials play a crucial role (Follow NCERT ) best material for the preparationWrite all important notes while you are learning from the NCERT and read that notes on a daily basis so that your concepts get strong day by dayPlease work on your weaker area but mainly prefer your strong area thand after if you have time left then work on a weak areaJoin online test series or mock tests and these both you can do through an online platform like (Toppr: Better learning for better results) or any other online instituteDon't do any guesswork in the exam because negative marking get down your marks so that please don't go guessworkBelieve in yourselfThese tips help you to prepare for the NEET All the very best 👍

Yes it is easy when you start from now and you are having a one year time in it I would simply say some points u must follow:- ∆for BIOLOGY ncert is more than enough u don't need to confuse yourselves with any other books study each lesson throughly and practise qns from MTG 32 yrs or any previous yr qn lessonwise book for neet. U should keep on revise the topics what u were already studied. ∆for CHEMISTRY read rk Gupta (arihant publication ) also solve qns in it.then also if u think you are having more time solve errorless book qns and at last time of preparations revise all concepts and formulas from arihant chemistry handbook. And solve the 32yrs MTG CHEMISTRY. ∆for PHYSICS it is more important you should not keep on changing your studing materials you should BE constant . Study in DC PANDEY PHYSICS(ARIHANT PUBLICATION) throughly practise the examples also in it.and already I said in chemistry if you have more time after solving all qns from dc than u solve errorless qns(it is more).at last revise all your concepts and formuls from arihant physics handbook .and solve neet 32yrs MTG physics. ALL I ABOVE MENTIONED IS MORE ENOUGH TO CLEAR NEET . ONE THING IF U SOLVE EACH AND EVERY QNS FROM ERRORLESS(USS) EASILY U CAN ACHIEVE 600+++ ∆ONE THING IS BE CONFIDENT AND CONSTANT IN WHAT U STUDY AND WITH WHICH U STUDY∆ And ALL THE BEST FUTURE DOCTOR

Everything is possible. Since you're looking for 2021 you do have a lot of time. If you're wishing to score 600+ and all, it depends on your EFFORT. If you study sincerely definitely you can crack it. Don't bother about what others are doing or dont think you're behind them and like that all. Focus on career right now rest everything are just scams. ALL THE BEST. YOU CAN DO IT
